title: Projectile motion - horizontal component of motion

content.question: A ball is kicked at a <math alttext="30 degree" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">°</mi></math> angle above level ground with initial speed <math alttext="12 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>. Immediately before the ball returns to the ground, the horizontal component of the velocity of the ball is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="6 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="10 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="12 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="10 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

topic.text: 1.5: Vectors and Motion in Two Dimensions

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
